explanation.text:
Explanation
Earth rotation causes day and night, deflection of ocean current, Deflection of winds, increasing inclination of the sun between sunrise and sunset, but does not cause seasonal changes. This is because seasons are caused by the planet's 23.4° declination.

text: Which of the following is not caused by the earth's rotation?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

subject: GEOGRAPHY

text: The outer structure of the earth is made up of the following except?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
option A is an importance of the Hydrosphere
option C is an importance of the Biosphere
option D is an importance of the Lithosphere
The Atmosphere is the gaseous portion of the earth. It is associated with the provision of gases required by living things e.g oxygen for combustion and respiration, nitrogen for protein synthesis by plants etc.

text: Which of the following is an importance of the atmosphere to living organisms?

options.text: It provides water for industrial uses
It provides oxygen for animals and plants for respiration
It provides shelter in form of timber for man
It aids transportation through construction of roads and railways

subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
The crust is subdivided into the upper part, containing minerals like silica, iron and magnesium(sima). The mantle is found beneath the crust and the core is surrounded by the mantle. Hence, the correct arrangement of the layers of the earth crust "sial, sima, mantle and core" from the surface to the interior.

text: The correct arrangement of the layers of the earth crust from the surface to the interior is
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the map is 20cm

text: If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the map is 20cm
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
map distance = 10cm, ground distance = ?
Map scale for (a) 1:100,000
Ground distance = 10 x 100,000/100,000 =10km
Map scale for (b) 1:400,000
Ground distance = 10 x 400,000/100,000 =40km

text: If the scale of two maps are (a;1:100,000 and b;1:400,000) what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the maps is 10cm
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
The inclination of some developing countries to their colonial masters has helped to increase the volume of trade between the nations

text: Which of the following is a reason for the high volume of trade between Nigeria and developed countries?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
The sea route through which Nigeria and Europe exchange their products is through the North Atlantic sea route and the following seaports are used:
Lagos-Antwerp(Belgium), Lagos-Rotterdam(Netherlands), Lagos-Hamburg(West Germany), Lagos-Southampton(Britain) while the sea route through which Nigeria and America exchange their products is the south Atlantic route and seaport used is Lagos-Montreal(Canada)

text: The following are seaports used in the North Atlantic sea route except
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation

text: _______ is the condition of the lower atmosphere of a place over a short period
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Diurnal range of temperature = Max.temperature - Mini.temperature for that day
Maximum daily temperature ≡ Hottest daily temperature
Minimum daily temperature ≡ Coldest daily temperature

text: In a combined maximum and minimum thermometer, the difference between the hottest and coldest daily temperature for that day gives the
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
JosPlateau falls in the North-Central highlands. Mining is an economic activity in Jos due to the presence of mineral resources like Tin.
Tin-Mining activities results in the environmental degradation on the Jos Plateau

text: Tin-mining activities in Nigeria are the main causes of environmental degradation on the?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
In the tropical forest, there is the absence of pure stands of trees.
In other words, in the tropical forest, the plant population do not consist largely of members of one specie, variety or type.

text: The high cost of lumbering operations in tropical forest is mainly due to?

options.text: Absence of pure stands of trees

subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
The atmosphere, biosphere and hydrosphere are all outer structure of the earth. The Mesosphere also known as the mantle is an internal structure of the earth which is found beneath the crust and surrounds the core(Barysphere)

text: The outer structure of the earth is made up of the following except?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
option A is an importance of the Hydrosphere
option C is an importance of the Biosphere
option D is an importance of the Lithosphere

explanation.text:
Explanation
map distance = 20cm, ground distance = Y
map scale = 2cm to 1km
since 2cm ≡ 1km
20cm ≡ Y
2Y = 20km
Y = 20km/2=10km
The ground distance between the two towns is 10km

text: If the scale of a map is 2cm to 1km, what is the ground distance if the distance between two towns on the map is 20cm?

Map scale for (a) 1:100,000

Ground distance = 10 x 400,000/100,000 =40k

explanation.text:
Explanation
carbon dioxide is removed from the air during photosynthesis as green plants use it to manufacture their food

text: Which of the following processes leads to the loss of carbon from the air?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Isohalines are lines drawn on maps to join all places in the ocean having equal degree of saltiness or concentration of salt or salinity

text: On maps, lines drawn to join all places in the ocean having equal degree of salinity are called?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Salinity is one of the causes of ocean currents. Where the salinity of an ocean is high, the ocean water is dense or heavy and creeps(or moves) at the bottom of the ocean to low salinity areas.

text: Where the salinity of an ocean is high;

options.text: the ocean water is dense and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area
the ocean water is dense and creeps at the bottom of the ocean towards low salinity areas
the ocean water is light and flows at the area surface towards a high salinity area
the ocean water is light and flows at the ocean surface towards a low salinity area

subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Field capacity is the type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off, following heavy rainfall. This water is available to all plants.

text: The type of water left in the soil after excess water has been drained off, following heavy rainfall is known as?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
No official explanation is available for this question at this time. Please check contributions posted by others below. If you can provide an explanation to help other student learn, please click here

subject: GEOGRAPHY

Explanation
All except shaded map are graphical representation of statistical data

text: Which of the following is not a graphical representation of statistical data?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
In the Tropical rainforest, the trees are not in pure stand i.e scattered

text: Which of the following is a vegetation characteristics of the Tropical rainforest?

options.text: Trees are not in pure stand
Tough, small, leathery, hairy leaves to guard against excessive transpiration

subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Landlocked countries refer to those countries which do not have an access or boundary with the coast or oceans. Examples are Mali, Niger, Sudan, Zambia etc. Landlocked countries depend politically on other countries.

text: Which of the following is a problem of landlocked countries?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
High cost of harnessing solar energy is a problem while adequacy of capital isn't

text: One of the following is not a problem involved in harnessing solar energy?

options.text: Fear of competition with established energy sources

subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Using either the mirror method or the prism square method, the optical square is used to mark out lines at right angles to the main chain line.

text: One of the following surveying instruments is used to set out lines at right angles to the main chain line?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Error of closure is the failure of the end point of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the transverse.
This error can only be known when the field details are plotted

text: ________is the failure of the end point of a closed traverse to fall exactly on the point of origin of the transverse?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Dendation involves breaking of the earth's surface hence levelling such surface through agents such as water, wind etc.

text: What is the process of lowering and leveling of the earth surface by gradual breaking and wearing away of such earth's surfaces?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
The time taken by the earth to move round the sun(i.e complete its orbit) is fixed at 365(1/4) days which makes up a year

text: Which of the following is an effect of the earth's revolution?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Denitrification is the major way by which nitrate in the soil is lost by its conversion to gaseous nitrogen with the aid of some denitrifying bacteria

text: The soil gains nitrogen through one of the following except?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Contour ploughing is the making of ridges across the slope to control erosion

text: Which of the following is a way of controlling soil erosion?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
A Watershed is a highland area which seperates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source

text: __________ is a highland area which seperates the headstreams of rivers flowing in different directions but rising from the same mountainous source?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Loess are loose, fine particles which are carried by wind and deposited outside the desert. Deposits of loess are found in North-West China

text: ___________ is a layer of very fine wind-deposited sand and silt?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
Africa leads the whole world in the production of gold. South Africa is the largest producer of gold.

text: An important mineral deposit in south Africa which has attracted a large number of white settler is?
subject: GEOGRAPHY

explanation.text:
Explanation
G.I.S means Geographic Information System

text: Which of the following gives the correct full meaning of G.I.S?
subject: GEOGRAPHY
